title: Assertion schema

$eref.description: An extension that allows an issuer to issue an Open Badge on the blockchain and provide proof of inclusion in a blockchain transaction. This uses the Chainpoint v2.0 specification: https://chainpoint.org/
$eref.title: MerkleProof2017 schema

_88JsonLdType.description: A type or an array of types defined in a JSON-LD context file.

10-digit UNIX timestamp, epoch time

___criteria.description: Defined by `criteria` property of https://w3id.org/openbadges#BadgeClass. This field is required in Open Badges, currently optional in Blockcerts for compatibility.

___signatureLines.description: Blockcerts extension: array of signature lines for display.

___subtitle.description: Blockcerts extension: optional subtitle of the certificate

$eref.description: A type or an array of types defined in a referenced JSON-LD context.

Defined by https://w3id.org/openbadges#Profile. This type is used in certificates, and in the issuer-hosted identification page. The minimal set of properties required in the certificate are `id` and `type`. In this case, additional issuer-identification properties are assumed to be available at the issuer-hosted identification page.

___revocationList.description: Defined by `revocationList` property of https://w3id.org/openbadges#Profile. If embedded in a Blockcert and the issuer-hosted Profile, the value in the Blockcert should take preference.

___issuer.description: Defined by `issuer` property of https://w3id.org/openbadges#BadgeClass, with Blockcerts extensions for blockchain verification of badges.

$eref.description: List of tags that describe the type of achievement.

An image representative of the entity. In Blockcerts this is typically a data URI (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_URI_scheme) embedded as a base-64 encoded PNG image, but it may also be a URI where the image may be found.

___id.description: Defined by `id` property of https://w3id.org/openbadges#BadgeClass. This field is required in Open Badges but currently optional in Blockcerts for compatibility. This may be an HTTP IRI, but only if the issuer plans to host the BadgeClass definitions on a long-term basis, or (at least) until expiration of certificates referencing this BadgeClass. Otherwise it is recommended to use a `urn:uuid:<UUID>`-formatted IRI.

$eref.description: Open Badges SHA-256 Hash

A Blockcerts extension allowing inclusion of additional recipient details, including recipient publicKey and name. Inclusion of the recipient publicKey allows the recipient to make a strong claim of ownership over the key, and hence the badge being awarded. In the future, publicKey will be deprecated in favor of a decentralized id (DID) in the `id` field.
$eref.title: RecipientProfile schema

___id.description: reserved for future use as DID

___publicKey.description: In Blockcerts `publicKey` IRIs are typically represented with a `<scheme>:` prefix. For Bitcoin transactions, this would be the recipient public Bitcoin address prefixed with `ecdsa-koblitz-pubkey:`; e.g. `ecdsa-koblitz-pubkey:14RZvYazz9H2DC2skBfpPVxax54g4yabxe`

_88AlignmentArray.description: List of objects describing which objectives or educational standards this badge aligns to, if any.

$eref.description: A type or an array of types defined in a referenced JSON-LD context.

___type.description: Defined by `type` property of https://w3id.org/openbadges#VerificationObject. Blockcerts extension: this should contain the entry `MerkleProofVerification2017`

___creator.description: Blockcerts extension: the expected blockchain address for the signer of the transaction containing the merkle proof. In Blockcerts `creator` IRIs are typically represented with a `<scheme>:` prefix. For Bitcoin transactions, this would be the issuer public Bitcoin address prefixed with `ecdsa-koblitz-pubkey:`; e.g. `ecdsa-koblitz-pubkey:14RZvYazz9H2DC2skBfpPVxax54g4yabxe`

anyOf.description: Issuer public key or blockchain address with `<scheme>:` prefix. For Bitcoin transactions, this would be the issuer public address prefixed with `ecdsa-koblitz-pubkey:`. Example: `ecdsa-koblitz-pubkey:14RZvYazz9H2DC2skBfpPVxax54g4yabxe`

$eref.description: An extension that allows issuers to add signature lines to the visual representation of the badge. This is not part of the cryptographic proof; it is for display purposes only.
$eref.title: SignatureLine schema

anyOf.description: An image representative of the entity. In Blockcerts this is typically a data URI (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_URI_scheme) embedded as a base-64 encoded PNG image, but it may also be a URI where the image may be found.
